name: Star Madagascar
description: Brasserie STAR Madagascar is the first brewery in Madagascar founded in 1947 by the company La Rochefortaise. It produces the main Malagasy beer.

name: La cotonn√®re d'Antsirabe
description: Groupe Socota's origins date back to 1930 when Socota, the Groups first entity was founded as a textile trading company in Madagascar. Today the fabric mill forms a key part of SOCOTA Textiles and Apparel, vertically integrated design, fabric, and garment operations offering unique fashion solutions to European and African markets.

name: Socolait Madagascar
description: Socolait is a leader in the production and distribution of dairy products in Madagascar: yogurt, butter, condensed milk, powdered milk, cheese, etc.

name: Tiko Oil Antsirabe
description: TIKO, a prominent company in Madagascar. Initially focused on dairy products, TIKO expanded to include fruit juices, cooking oil, ice cream, and carbonated beverages. The company's growth was supported by a loan from the World Bank, which allowed TIKO to outcompete other dairy producers in Madagascar.

name: Cementis Ibity
description: CEMENTIS is a new Regional Group supplying cement, and related products, throughout the Indian Ocean Islands of Mauritius, Reunion, Mayotte, and Comoros.

name: Mado Company
description: Mado is a mountain spring water bottling company. Its source is located on the mountain of Iharanandriana, in the village of Morarano 38km south of Antananarivo, road to Antsirabe.

name: Ciel Textile
address: 5th Floor, Ebene Skies, Rue de l'Institut, Ebene, Mauritius
description: CIEL Textile is a world-class global player in textile and garments operations, present in Mauritius, Madagascar, India & Bangladesh. CIEL Textile's vision is to be the Best Global Fashion Partner with the objective to deliver unbeatable value to medium and upmarket retailers.
